questions.question: Please write more …………………………
questions.description: Here the adverb legibly modifies the verb write.

questions.question: How is your grandmother? Is she any …………………………..?
questions.description: Use the comparative form when there is an idea of change.

questions.question: He can speak …………………………… German.
questions.description: Here the adjective fluent modifies the noun German.

questions.question: The small house was …………………………… bigger than a hut.
She works the ………………………. when she does something for her family.
questions.description: Use the superlative form after the.

questions.question: A car cannot carry as ………………………… people as a bus.
questions.description: Use the positive form of the adjective in the expression as...as... Use many with plural nouns and much with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: That was a …………………………… thing to do.
I ……………………….. watch action movies.
questions.description: Either rarely or seldom is possible here.

questions.question: They waited ……………………………. for their father.
questions.description: Here the adverb anxiously modifies the verb waited.

questions.question: All of a …………………………., a dark figure emerged in the hallway.
He ran as ………………………… as he could.
questions.description: Fast can be an adjective and an adverb. The positive form is used in the expression as...as...

questions.question: She looked …………………………
questions.description: Look is a copular verb. We use adjectives, not adverbs to modify copular verbs.
